sn7.4:1.2: Bilaṅga (here, “bitter”) is allowed with other medicinal fruits at Kd 6:6.1.4. It is Sanskrit viḍaṅga, identified as embelia ribes or “false black pepper”. It is normally given as an example of poor food (SN 3.19:2.5).
sn7.4:1.3: The commentary says he was too angry to speak because his brothers, in the previous three discourses, had ordained.
